techmeme.title: A look at Tools for Humanity, cofounded by Sam Altman, as the company plans to deploy 7,500 iris-scanning Orbs across the US over the next 12 months (Billy Perrigo/Time)
Inside a "laptop farm" run by a 50-year-old US woman that let DPRK IT workers pose as US tech staff and illegally earn $17.1M from more than 300 US companies (Wall Street Journal)
Q&A with Luther Lowe, YC's first full-time lobbyist, on advocating for "Little Tech" and ensuring that startups have a voice in Washington, DC, and Brussels (Tim Bradshaw/Financial Times)
A recent surge in high-profile cyberattacks is boosting cyber insurers' prospects, with global premium volume expected to hit ~$30B by 2030, growing at 10% YoY (Bloomberg)
Humain, Saudi Arabia's new state-owned AI company, says it is seeking investment from US tech companies and investors, and plans to launch a $10B VC fund (Financial Times)
